Andres -

A number =
of years back a group of women from the Chicago area put on an
absolutely a=
wesome demonstration of naginata usage, the first (and last)
I've ever expe=
rienced. It would be an interesting demonstration to again
present at one o=
f our sword shows particularly for us non-martial arts guys
and gals.

Ron

Mark,

Thanks for the info on Kendo World and the Naginata book. I'll loo=
k
into it. I am a "practitioner"-, although the weapon I mostly train
with =
is the katana. Nonetheless, I started training with naginata,
too, about, o=
h, 3 years ago. I'm still a rank beginner, but I'm very
much interested in =
it as a weapon. I also started training in Yari
around the same time. But w=
hile I practice and learn katana waza
weekly, or sometimes more often, I do=
 naginata and yari maybe once a month.

Best Regards,

Andres
